Quote from @vexking’s bestselling book “Good Vibes, Good Life” – available from most major bookstores. Follow @vexking for words of wisdom like the ones below! 🌟⁣
.
“We are not placed on this Earth to endure harm—no matter who it comes from. Love does not ask us to shrink beneath cruelty. Spirituality does not ask us to excuse what wounds and weathers our well-being.
.
Sometimes, the people closest to us—those we are taught to revere without question—are the very ones who cause the deepest harm. Family ties can be sacred, but they are not a free pass for abuse, manipulation, or emotional neglect.
.
Pretending someone’s harmful behaviour is acceptable only extends the cycle of suffering. It teaches us to betray ourselves in the name of loyalty.⁣ You are allowed to draw a sacred line. You are allowed to protect your peace—even if that means creating distance from those who refuse to honour it.⁣
.
Cutting ties with a family member is not a failure of love—it is often the greatest act of self-love. It is the soul’s quiet rebellion against patterns that were never meant to be carried forward.⁣
.
Boundaries provide clarity. They are the prayer that says: “I will no longer sacrifice my wellness for someone else’s unwillingness to love me in the way I deserve.”
.
If you need to walk away from continued harm, do it with no regrets. Grieve if you must, heal at your own pace, but know this—you are not wrong for choosing yourself.⁣
.
You were never meant to suffer endlessly, regardless of whether it’s your “family.” You were meant to live, to expand, to embody love—and sometimes, love means letting go.⁣–#VexKing
